elements.title: Wuhan trolleybus route 1 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that for nearly 65 years, Wuhan trolleybus route 1 (pictured) included a loop around a statue of Sun Yat-sen?

elements.title: Ernest de Munck (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Stradivarius cello once owned by Ernest de Munck is now named after him?

elements.title: Félag hljómplötuframleiðenda (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Félag hljómplötuframleiðenda tried to close the file-sharing website Istorrent in 2007–2008, but the Supreme Court of Iceland dismissed the case?

elements.title: a banker (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a banker was named the prime minister of Equatorial Guinea after his predecessor resigned during an economic crisis?

elements.title: his first short film (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that while shooting his first short film, Jean-Luc Godard was barred from his mother's funeral for stealing?

elements.title: Brenden Bates (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Brenden Bates "loves moving people against their will"?

elements.title: a fort in Baguia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a fort in Baguia was restored to be converted into tourist accommodation?

elements.title: The New York Times Simulator (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The New York Times Simulator was inspired by its creator's frustration with media coverage of the Israel–Hamas war?
